## Linear Regression

```{r}
#Eexample 2
x <- matrix(rnorm(400), ncol = 4) # so this is a 100x4 predictor matrix 
y <- rnorm(100)                   # this is our outcome variable, a 100x1 vector
n <- length(y)  
X<-cbind(rep(1, dim(x)[1]), x)     # adding a column of 1s as intercept to the design matrix X (100 x 5)
p <- ncol(X)
df <- n - p
#initial values 
beta0 <- rep(NA, ncol(X))
beta0[1] <- mean(y)
for (i in 2:ncol(X)){ 
  beta0[i] <- cov(X[,i],y)/var(X[,i])
}
#beta0

# defining the cost function
our_lm = function(y, X, beta0) {
  R <- sum((y - X%*%beta0)^2)
  
}

#the minimization
m <- optim(par = beta0, fn = our_lm, y = y, X = X)
# Return the estimated value of beta
beta.hat <- m$par
#beta.hat


# Checking fittness of the model
y_hat  <- X%*% beta.hat
SSE <- sum((y - y_hat)^2)
SST <- sum((y - mean(y))^2)
R_sq <- 1 - (SSE/SST)  #coefficient of determination

#computing the residuals
resid <- y - X%*% as.matrix(beta.hat)
sigma2.hat <- (i/df) * t(resid) %*% resid
Cp <- SSE + 2*p*sigma2.hat #Mallow's Cp
```
